help.short: Activates the specified application package. This should be done after the `ApplicationPackage` was created and uploaded. This needs to be done before an `ApplicationPackage` can be used on Pools or Tasks.

Create an application package record. The record contains a storageUrl where the package should be uploaded to.  Once it is uploaded the `ApplicationPackage` needs to be activated using `ApplicationPackageActive` before it can be used. If the auto storage account was configured to use storage keys, the URL returned will contain a SAS.
Delete an application package record and its associated binary file.
List all of the application packages in the specified application.
Get information about the specified application package.
Manage Version
Create an application to the specified Batch account.
Delete an application.
List all of the applications in the specified account.
Get information about the specified application.
Update settings for the specified application.
Manage Application

If you try to delete a certificate that is being used by a pool or compute node, the status of the certificate changes to deleteFailed. If you decide that you want to continue using the certificate, you can use this operation to set the status of the certificate back to active. If you intend to delete the certificate, you do not need to run this operation after the deletion failed. You must make sure that the certificate is not being used by any resources, and then you can try again to delete the certificate.
Create a new certificate inside the specified account.
Delete the specified certificate.
List all of the certificates in the specified account.
Get information about the specified certificate.
Update the properties of an existing certificate.
Manage Certificate
List information about the detectors available for a given Batch account.
Get information about the given detector for a given Batch account.
Manage Detector

List all of the NSP configurations in the specified account.
Reconciles the specified NSP configuration.
Get information about the specified NSP configuration.
Manage Network Security Perimeter Configuration

List the endpoints that a Batch Compute Node under this Batch Account may call as part of Batch service administration. If you are deploying a Pool inside of a virtual network that you specify, you must make sure your network allows outbound access to these endpoints. Failure to allow access to these endpoints may cause Batch to mark the affected nodes as unusable. For more information about creating a pool inside of a virtual network, see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-virtual-network
Manage Outbound Network Dependencies Endpoint

Create a new pool inside the specified account.
Delete the specified pool.
Disables automatic scaling for a pool.
List all of the pools in the specified account.
Get information about the specified pool.

This does not restore the pool to its previous state before the resize operation: it only stops any further changes being made, and the pool maintains its current state. After stopping, the pool stabilizes at the number of nodes it was at when the stop operation was done. During the stop operation, the pool allocation state changes first to stopping and then to steady. A resize operation need not be an explicit resize pool request; this API can also be used to halt the initial sizing of the pool when it is created.
Update the properties of an existing pool.
Manage Pool
Delete the specified private endpoint connection.
List all of the private endpoint connections in the specified account.
Get information about the specified private endpoint connection.
Update the properties of an existing private endpoint connection.
Manage Private Endpoint Connection
List all of the private link resources in the specified account.

Manage Private Link Resource
Create a new Batch account with the specified parameters. Existing accounts cannot be updated with this API and should instead be updated with the Update Batch Account API.
Delete the specified Batch account.
List information about the Batch accounts associated with the subscription.

This operation applies only to Batch accounts with allowedAuthenticationModes containing 'SharedKey'. If the Batch account doesn't contain 'SharedKey' in its allowedAuthenticationMode, clients cannot use shared keys to authenticate, and must use another allowedAuthenticationModes instead. In this case, getting the keys will fail.

This operation applies only to Batch accounts with allowedAuthenticationModes containing 'SharedKey'. If the Batch account doesn't contain 'SharedKey' in its allowedAuthenticationMode, clients cannot use shared keys to authenticate, and must use another allowedAuthenticationModes instead. In this case, regenerating the keys will fail.
Get information about the specified Batch account.
Synchronizes access keys for the auto-storage account configured for the specified Batch account, only if storage key authentication is being used.
Update the properties of an existing Batch account.
Manage Batch Account
List the list of Batch supported Cloud Service VM sizes available at the given location.
Manage Cloud Service Skus
Get the Batch service quotas for the specified subscription at the given location.
Manage Quota
List the list of Batch supported Virtual Machine VM sizes available at the given location.
Manage Virtual Machine Skus
Checks whether the Batch account name is available in the specified region.
Manage Batch
